reasoning: Multi-entity hierarchical feature (workspace → teams → members) with RBAC. Scope spans 10-15 files across backend + frontend. No external integrations but requires careful security design for roles and invitations. High uncertainty due to vague requirements.

scope.notes: Backend API (FastAPI) + Frontend UI (React). Hierarchical structure requires models, routes, controllers, UI components for workspaces, teams, and members.

integrations.notes: CSV parsing uses standard libraries. Invite link generation is custom token-based logic. No external APIs involved.

infrastructure.notes: Requires new database tables (workspaces, teams, members, invitations). No Docker or major infrastructure changes needed. May need minor .env additions.

knowledge.notes: JWT auth patterns exist in integration-service. Need to explore codebase for existing RBAC patterns, database schema conventions, and API route structure.

concerns: Extremely vague requirements with no acceptance criteria
Security-sensitive: role management and invite token generation
Unclear which service(s) should own this functionality
RBAC implementation complexity (3 roles with different permissions)
Potential for scope creep without clear boundaries
risk.notes: High risk due to requirement ambiguity. Needs extensive discovery phase to understand where this fits in architecture and what existing patterns can be leveraged.

validation_recommendations.reasoning: RBAC and invitation system are security-sensitive. Requires comprehensive testing including E2E for full workspace→teams→members flows and security scan for role permission verification and token handling.
